node.title: Intel arm of DHS defends office amid GOP senator's criticism
node.description: Senator Marsha Blackburn had accused the office of trying to police Americans' speech and thoughts.

node.title: Teens involved in New Jersey mall fight speak out after video sparks outrage
node.description: The teen who was allowed to sit on a couch as police handcuffed a Black teen said he was confused why he didn't receive a similar response.

node.title: Nonprofit aims to close resource gap for Black entrepreneurs in Mississippi
node.description: Black entrepreneurs said they've had trouble securing loans. Higher Purpose is connecting with them resources.

node.title: Senate passes short-term government funding to avert shutdown
node.description: The government will now be fully funded through March 11.

node.title: Kevin McCarthy backs Liz Cheney's primary challenger Harriet Hageman
node.description: His endorsement against a former member of his House leadership team comes after the Republican National Committee censured Cheney.

node.title: Burning cargo ship is adrift in mid-Atlantic without crew
node.description: The Felicity Ace, which was carrying Volkswagen Group vehicles to the U.S., is adrift near Portugal's Azores Islands.

node.title: Trooper sues former N.Y. Governor Cuomo for discrimination, retaliation
node.description: The New York State Police and former Cuomo aide Melissa DeRosa are also named in the lawsuit, which alleges he sexually harassed the trooper for years.

node.title: Sure, Brut deodorant sprays recalled nationwide due to benzene
node.description: Analysis finds "unexpected levels" of human carcinogen coming from propellant that sprays product out of the can.

node.title: Kiwifruit grower and post harvest operator Seeka reports record revenue
node.description: Kiwifruit grower and post harvest operator Seeka has reported a record revenue for the year driven by a rebound in kiwifruit volumes and a lift in production.

node.title: One person dead in Timaru crash
node.description: Police have confirmed one person has died following a single-vehicle crash in Timaru this afternoon.

node.title: Tree cover drops to below 14 percent in Christchurch - survey
node.description: Tree cover in Christchurch has dropped to just under 14 percent, the lowest of Aotearoa's three main centres. Audio

node.title: More than 1kg of meth seized, nine arrested in Wairoa
node.description: More than 1kg of methamphetamine has been seized and nine people have been arrested, including gang members, in Wairoa, Hawke's Bay.

node.title: Police still looking for family missing again after going bush last year
node.description: A warrant of arrest remains for Thomas Phillips, the King Country man who went missing with his three children in Marokopa last year.

node.title: 28,000 Saudi women apply for 30 train driver jobs
node.description: In the first time train driver jobs have been advertised for women in Saudi Arabia, a rail company says it has received 28,000 applications for 30 positions.

node.title: Trump, children ordered to testify in NY attorney general probe
node.description: A New York judge has ruled Donald Trump and two of his adult children must answer questions under oath in the state attorney general's civil probe into their family company's business.

node.title: Buller water restrictions in place due to flood damaged pipeline
node.description: Essential water use restrictions are now in place for Westport and Carters Beach after flooding damaged a large section of the region's water pipeline.

node.title: 'Blatant stupidity': Students host large party despite outbreak
node.description: Dunedin police have slammed those who organised and attended a large party in the city's student quarter last night, with Covid-19 cases now confirmed in the community.

node.title: Valieva misses podium in Beijing
node.description: Russian teenage figure skater Kamila Valieva tumbled to fourth place in the women's singles event at the Beijing Games.

node.title: Prince Andrew: source of settlement money, future of royal title
node.description: Analysis - Prince Andrew and Virginia Giuffre have reached a settlement. Although this was always a likely outcome, the statement is worth probing in detail.

node.title: France and allies to withdraw troops from Mali
node.description: The French president said the decision to leave followed a breakdown in diplomatic relations, amid growing hostility from Mali's governing military junta.

node.title: Covid-19 misinformation fliers breach advertising standards - ASA
node.description: The advertising watchdog has upheld 101 complaints about misinformation about Covid-19 in glossy flyers distributed to homes around New Zealand by the anti-mandate group, Voices for Freedom.

node.title: Unvaccinated Dunedin eye surgeon fined for seeing patients
node.description: A Dunedin eye surgeon has been fined $4000 for seeing patients while unvaccinated for Covid-19 and is no longer able to practice in New Zealand, the Ministry of Health says.

node.title: Police make second arrest after robbery and assault with suspected link to man's death
node.description: Police have arrested a second man in relation to an aggravated robbery and an assault in TƒÅneatua, Bay of Plenty, on Monday.

node.title: More households paying down their mortgages, Westpac data shows
node.description: More homeowners are choosing to put extra money on their mortgage.

node.title: Hate speech from protesters should not be tolerated - law professor
node.description: A Waikato University law professor says he is not surprised by the results of a snap poll suggesting 30 percent of New Zealanders support the protest on Parliament's lawn. Audio

node.title: Migrant doctors head overseas in face of 'unaccommodating' immigration system
node.description: Consultants are among an exodus of medical staff from New Zealand to countries whose immigration policies are more attractive.

node.title: Homicide inquiry launched after man's body found in river
node.description: Police have named the man found by a member of the public in a Waikato river on Tuesday afternoon, sparking a homicide investigation.

node.title: Parliament protesters relying on donated food
node.description: Many of the protesters are relying on food donated from around the country.

node.title: Thousands sign petition seeking justice for assaulted Muslim teen
node.description: A petition calling for justice for an Otago Muslim teenager who was attacked at her school has more than 42,000 signatures just a day after it launched.

node.title: One in 10 Middlemore ED patients testing positive for Covid-19
node.description: Since Tuesday, one in every 10 people presenting at the Middlemore Hospital emergency department has tested positive for Covid-19, and that number is expected to go up. Audio
